intro: Francoeuria undulata, commonly known as the undulating francoeuria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, undulating leaf patterns. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
